content:
• Monday, August 29, 2011
  • WINN

    Shares of Winn-Dixie (NASDAQ:WINN) fall 5% AH after the firm misses FY11 EPS estimates by $0.02,...

    Shares of Winn-Dixie (NASDAQ:WINN) fall 5% AH after the firm misses FY11 EPS estimates by $0.02, and issues guidance for FY12 same store sales at 2.5%-3%. The grocery store chain says it sees higher operating and administrative expenses in FY12 due to increases in payroll and payroll expenses, as well as capital expenditures of $200M led by a store remodeling program.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • CULP

    Culp (CFI): FQ1 EPS of $0.14. Revenue of $60.3M (+7.8% Y/Y) beats by $2.9M. Board authorizes a...

    Culp (CFI): FQ1 EPS of $0.14. Revenue of $60.3M (+7.8% Y/Y) beats by $2.9M. Board authorizes a $2M stock buyback. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • CLGX

    CoreLogic (NYSE:CLGX) is forming an independent committee to explore strategic options including...

    CoreLogic (NYSE:CLGX) is forming an independent committee to explore strategic options including a possible spinoff, merger or sale of the business. The company says it's retained Greenhill & Co. to advise on possible moves. Shares +15% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • CAKE

    Cheesecake Factory (CAKE +4.2%) and PF Chang's (PFCB +4.6%) both staged a post-Irene bounce...

    Cheesecake Factory (CAKE +4.2%) and PF Chang's (PFCB +4.6%) both staged a post-Irene bounce today, after the storm's impact cause far less damage than expected. William Blair had noted on Friday that the two chains had a large percentage of their restaurant locations in the storms projected path.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL), which gained 85% last week thanks to a partnership with Samsung...

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL), which gained 85% last week thanks to a partnership with Samsung (OTC:SSNLF), is up 7.2% AH after announcing a licensing deal and material supply agreement with Panasonic Idemitsu OLED Lighting. Unlike the Samsung deal, the Panasonic Idemitsu deal calls for royalty payments on OLED product sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • MSFT

    Shares of LinkedIn (LNKD +10.2%) enjoy a late afternoon runup following a trend set earlier in...

    Shares of LinkedIn (LNKD +10.2%) enjoy a late afternoon runup following a trend set earlier in the day with online travel and real estate sites. The NASDAQ Internet Index is up 3.8% for the day, outpacing other tech indices.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • AAL

    Shares of AMR (AMR +7.4%) are on the move after Ticonderoga says its Sell rating is no longer...

    Shares of AMR (AMR +7.4%) are on the move after Ticonderoga says its Sell rating is no longer justified after their recent drop. "With ample cash and a scant $1.1B in equity market value representing only 6% of adjusted enterprise value, we believe the reward/risk outlook for the shares is close to even," a research note says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • GTIV

    Shares of Gentiva Health Services (GTIV +13.6%) jump after the home health services company's...

    Shares of Gentiva Health Services (GTIV +13.6%) jump after the home health services company's Friday announcement that it will sell the rest of its stake in CareCentrix, and expects to realize net new cash flow of $65M-$70M from the transaction. But shares could remain weighed by uncertainty over future Medicare payment rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • BAC

    It's not just the mega financial names like BofA (BAC +6.6%) and Citigroup (C +4.1%) moving...

    It's not just the mega financial names like BofA (BAC +6.6%) and Citigroup (C +4.1%) moving higher today after a decent day for European and economic news, a whole slew of brokerage firms and investment banking companies are joining the party. Strong gainers include: PJC +8.11%, JEF +6.9%, KBW +5.9%, RODM +5.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • CEDC

    Central European Distribution (CEDC +42%) soars after regulatory filings show that between July...

    Central European Distribution (CEDC +42%) soars after regulatory filings show that between July 18 and August 26 investor Mark Kaufman acquired around 6.74M common shares, representing a 9.6% stake in the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • CEB

    Corporate Executive Board (EXBD +4.6%) joins the legions of companies announcing buybacks this...

    Corporate Executive Board (EXBD +4.6%) joins the legions of companies announcing buybacks this month, as its board approves a new $50M repurchase program.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • INT

    World Fuel Services (INT +3.9%) is trading higher today after announcing a leadership...

    World Fuel Services (INT +3.9%) is trading higher today after announcing a leadership transition, saying Michael Kasbar will become CEO effective Jan. 1, while current Chief Executive Officer Paul Stebbins will remain executive chairman.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • LTXB

    ViewPoint Financial (VPFG +4.4%) is higher today after anouncing plans to buy back up to 5% of...

    ViewPoint Financial (VPFG +4.4%) is higher today after anouncing plans to buy back up to 5% of its common shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • XEC

    Cimarex Energy (XEC +4.3%) trades higher after unveiling its succession plan, naming Thomas E....

    Cimarex Energy (XEC +4.3%) trades higher after unveiling its succession plan, naming Thomas E. Jorden as President and Chief Executive Officer, and saying its current  CEO F.H. Merelli will retain his title as chairman to guide the company's long-term strategy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • JWN

    Nordstrom (JWN +5.6%) begins offering free shipping and returns for all purchases made online....

    Nordstrom (JWN +5.6%) begins offering free shipping and returns for all purchases made online. The cost of shipping is seen by many shoppers as a big drawback of shopping online, but free shipping is a risk to store margins. Only a few big-name retailers offer free shipping with no strings attached; Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) offers it on orders of $25 or more.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • B

    Shares of Barnes Group (NYSE:B) gain +5.4% today after BB&T ups the company to buy from...

    Shares of Barnes Group (NYSE:B) gain +5.4% today after BB&T ups the company to buy from hold, saying its high-margin aerospace business is showing signs of strenth.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • MU

    Despite a shaky long-term prognosis, Micron (MU +6.7%) and other semiconductor firms (SMH +2.5%)...

    Despite a shaky long-term prognosis, Micron (MU +6.7%) and other semiconductor firms (SMH +2.5%) are surging amid a surprising rise in spot prices for memory chips. It's "the first time you have seen any increases in DRAM average selling price in 3-4 months," one analyst notes. Also: AMD +3.8%, STM +4.1%, SNDK +6.2%, RMBS +5.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • GVA

    Civil contractor Granite Construction (GVA +9.7%) gains on a BB&T valuation upgrade to buy....

    Civil contractor Granite Construction (GVA +9.7%) gains on a BB&T valuation upgrade to buy. The firm says that despite the company's tough business outlook, the stock is trading below tangible book and offers "an attractive long-term opportunity."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • EPL

    Energy Partners (EPL +8.9%) is up on the day after its board authorizes a $20M share repurchase...

    Energy Partners (EPL +8.9%) is up on the day after its board authorizes a $20M share repurchase program. The buyback represents around 4% of the company's outstanding stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • BAC

    All 10 major S&P sectors are up by 1% or more, but financials (XLF +3.5%) are spiking...

    All 10 major S&P sectors are up by 1% or more, but financials (XLF +3.5%) are spiking following bank beatdowns of recent weeks and a bid for insurers (KIE +5.3%) after Irene's damage appears less severe than feared. Bank of America (BAC +6%) rallies (earlier) even after at least two firms lower price targets. Also: JPM +2.9%, WFC +2.9%, C +3.8%, MS +3.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • Z

    Zillow (Z +4.8%) captures the attention of analysts roughly a month after its IPO. Think Equity...

    Zillow (Z +4.8%) captures the attention of analysts roughly a month after its IPO. Think Equity initiates coverage with a Hold rating and a $31 PT, while a more optimistic Citi - seeing a strong growth profile for Z - fires up a Buy rating and a $36 PT.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN +3.2%) continues to gain after the drug developer's Atlanta manufacuring facility...

    Dendreon (DNDN +3.2%) continues to gain after the drug developer's Atlanta manufacuring facility was given FDA approval to produce its cancer drug Provenge on Friday. The stock is now up 11% over the past two sessions on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • JNY

    Apparel maker Jones Group (JNY +5.3%) is up today on a positive article in Barron's over the...

    Apparel maker Jones Group (JNY +5.3%) is up today on a positive article in Barron's over the weekend that says the company is making a comeback after more than five years of disappointing results.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • LHO

    Commercial REIT LaSalle Hotel Properties (LHO +8.2%) takes advantage of recent weakness in its...

    Commercial REIT LaSalle Hotel Properties (LHO +8.2%) takes advantage of recent weakness in its shares and approves a $100M stock buyback.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • DCI

    Donaldson Company (NYSE:DCI) shares are up 6.3% after the firm records a $0.05 EPS beat on Q4...

    Donaldson Company (NYSE:DCI) shares are up 6.3% after the firm records a $0.05 EPS beat on Q4 revenue of $625M (+22% Y/Y) on the strength of its engine and industrial products segments. The firm sees sales growth at 7%-15% for FY12, and sets EPS guidance at $3.15-$4.15.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • AWAY

    Shares of HomeAway (AWAY +9.1%) and Expedia (EXPE +4%) are riding the coattails of Travelzoo's...

    Shares of HomeAway (AWAY +9.1%) and Expedia (EXPE +4%) are riding the coattails of Travelzoo's (TZOO +11.7%) big surge, as investors flock to companies connected to online travel. A flurry of travel deals posted online after last week's pre-hurricane jitters may be contributing to the positive sentiment.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • SMP

    Automotive replacement parts manufacturer Standard Motor Products (SMP +9.3%) jumps higher today...

    Automotive replacement parts manufacturer Standard Motor Products (SMP +9.3%) jumps higher today after its board authorizes a $5M stock buyback.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • MSG

    Madison Square Garden (MSG +4.2%) gains after Maxim raises it to buy from hold, noting that...

    Madison Square Garden (MSG +4.2%) gains after Maxim raises it to buy from hold, noting that revenue losses due to the arena's transformation and NBA lockout are already reflected in the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • WINN

    Shares of Winn-Dixie (WINN +10.1%) are up sharply in advance of the company's Q4 earnings report...

    Shares of Winn-Dixie (WINN +10.1%) are up sharply in advance of the company's Q4 earnings report tonight, but they aren't the only outperformer among grocery stores names. A heightened mindset of consumers to "stock up" following the major earthquake and hurricane within the last week may be driving sentiment. Winners include: SVU 4.7%, TFM +3.3%, RDK +3.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • AEGN

    Insituform Technologies (INSU +5.9%) pops this morning after Janney Capital ups it to buy on...

    Insituform Technologies (INSU +5.9%) pops this morning after Janney Capital ups it to buy on valuation. Janney says its energy, mining, and sewer rehabilitation businesses in Europe and Asia are all well-positioned for growth in H2.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 2 Comments
  • TZOO

    Travelzoo (TZOO +9.8%) shoots higher following Friday's news that Facebook plans to shut down...

    Travelzoo (TZOO +9.8%) shoots higher following Friday's news that Facebook plans to shut down its daily deals program, perhaps easing competitive pressure on industry leaders. But Travelzoo also has been a rumored takeover candidate, so a fresh round of speculation could be pushing shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • PPP

    Primero Mining (MNOCF.PK -16.6%) is the big loser in AuRico Gold's (AUQ -12.3%) buyout of...

    Primero Mining (MNOCF.PK -16.6%) is the big loser in AuRico Gold's (AUQ -12.3%) buyout of Northgate Minerals (NXG +38%). Northgate orignially planned to buy Primero for C$370M, but terminated the agreement after accepting the buyout offer from AuRico. Primero, waiving its right to match the deal, will receive a C$25M termination fee.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • TR

    TRW Automotive (TR +6.4%) gains after a report says the cost of collision-avoidance systems...

    TRW Automotive (TR +6.4%) gains after a report says the cost of collision-avoidance systems utilizing radar and cameras will be low enough to be mass produced shortly. A TRW rep predicts in 10 years every car will be equipped with a forward-looking camera to assist drivers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • NXPI

    NXP Semiconductors (NXPI +3.3%) shares spike after the company sells a patent portfolio for...

    NXP Semiconductors (NXPI +3.3%) shares spike after the company sells a patent portfolio for magnetoresistive random access memory chips to privately-held Crocus Technology, a move that comes as companies across the technology industry step up efforts to acquire patents. Financial terms were not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • VIAV

    Volatile optical component names are among the big winners in early trading. JDSU +7.4%. OCLR...

    Volatile optical component names are among the big winners in early trading. JDSU +7.4%. OCLR +8.9%. FNSR +5.3%. Optical networking equipment vendor Ciena (CIEN +8.3%) is also shooting higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • DXC

    Computer Sciences (CSC +2.7%) is higher this morning after winning an $83M contract from the...

    Computer Sciences (CSC +2.7%) is higher this morning after winning an $83M contract from the U.S. Postal Service to provide management, operational and logistical support for two mail service centers located in Minnesota and New Jersey.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • FRO

    FBR Capital slashes its PT on shares of Frontline (FRO -5%) to $8, as the firm's fleet of 70...

    FBR Capital slashes its PT on shares of Frontline (FRO -5%) to $8, as the firm's fleet of 70 tankers makes it tricky to steer through an industry slump. Potentially better-positioned rivals are posting healthy gains including DryShips (DRYS +6.2%), Overseas Shipholding (OSG +6.2%) and Seaspan (SSW +3.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • DRC

    Shares of Dresser-Rand (DRC +10.2%) pop after the firm announced late on Friday an accelerated...

    Shares of Dresser-Rand (DRC +10.2%) pop after the firm announced late on Friday an accelerated $150M stock buyback, representing 5% of outstanding shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • GLD

    Gold is diving, dropping $30 in the last 15 minutes to $1,793/oz. - red for the day after...

    Gold is diving, dropping $30 in the last 15 minutes to $1,793/oz. - red for the day after powerful early gains. Is another margin hike in the offing? GLD -1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC +3.2%) confirms that it will sell 13.1B shares of China Construction Bank...

    Bank of America (BAC +3.2%) confirms that it will sell 13.1B shares of China Construction Bank (OTCPK:CICHY). The sale is expected to generate ~$8.3B in cash proceeds and an after-tax gain of ~$3.3B; it should generate ~$3.5B in additional Tier 1 common capital under Basel I. BofA retains a 5% stake in CCB.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • LPL

    LCD panel maker LG Display (NYSE:LPL), which cut its 2011 capex forecast last month, is now...

    LCD panel maker LG Display (NYSE:LPL), which cut its 2011 capex forecast last month, is now cutting its 2012 forecast as well, thanks to soft PC and TV sales. Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT), which reported soft orders for its display manufacturing gear last week, can't be happy to hear LG's news. However, Wall Street seems pleased - LPL is currently up 5.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • DNKN

    Shares of Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) are too pricey, Morningstar analyst Joscelyn Mackay tells...

    Shares of Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) are too pricey, Morningstar analyst Joscelyn Mackay tells Barron's. "I'm very optimistic on Dunkin's growth potential, but I don't think that justifies the lofty valuation." Shares are down 2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM

  • Shortly before the U.S. open, European shares move to their highs of the session. Stoxx 50...

    Shortly before the U.S. open, European shares move to their highs of the session. Stoxx 50 +2.2%, Germany +2%, France +2.1%, Spain +2.8%, Italy +2.3%. U.K. closed. Greece now higher by 16%, with the banking subindex up about 30%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • AUQ

    Premarket gainers: NXG +46%. SBG +38%. VQ +30%. YOKU +10%. TGB +9%. CIGX +8%. MU +4%. PFE +3%....

    Premarket gainers: NXG +46%. SBG +38%. VQ +30%. YOKU +10%. TGB +9%. CIGX +8%. MU +4%. PFE +3%. RF +3%. MGM +3%. BAC +3%. OVTI +3%. BBVA +3%. AUO +3%.
    Losers: FRO -3%. LDK -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • YOKU

    Youku.com (NYSE:YOKU) +9% premarket after announcing an online distribution agreement for rights...

    Youku.com (NYSE:YOKU) +9% premarket after announcing an online distribution agreement for rights to the DreamWorks Animation (NASDAQ:DWA) KungFu Panda franchise films in Mainland China. It's the first time DreamWorks Animation titles will be made available through an online platform in China.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • RCL

    Royal Caribbean Cruises (NYSE:RCL) tacks on a 3.4% gain premarket, after jumping 4.2% in...

    Royal Caribbean Cruises (NYSE:RCL) tacks on a 3.4% gain premarket, after jumping 4.2% in Friday's trading on news its CEO took a larger stake. The firm says it hasn't been able to assess damage from Hurricane Irene to its private island in the Bahamas yet.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) is up 2.5% premarket, and Cisco Systems (NASDAQ:CSCO) up 1%, after...

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) is up 2.5% premarket, and Cisco Systems (NASDAQ:CSCO) up 1%, after Ticonderoga reiterates Buy ratings on the companies, believing VMware's (NYSE:VMW) VMworld conference this week will put the spotlight back on cloud computing. Cisco plans to unveil several products at VMworld.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM
  • NBGGY

    It appears they like the news. Greek shares sky on the merger and planned recapitalization of...

    It appears they like the news... Greek shares sky on the merger and planned recapitalization of the country's 2nd and 3rd-largest banks; the Athens General Index +14.3%. For perspective, the index has fallen more than 50% the last 6 months. Not part of the merger: National Bank of Greece (NBG) +30% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • HD

    Shares of Home Depot (NYSE:HD) are up 3% premarket, as reports pile in that shelves at stores...

    Shares of Home Depot (NYSE:HD) are up 3% premarket, as reports pile in that shelves at stores over a wide swath of the Atlantic Coast were wiped clean as consumers and businesses prepared for Hurricane Irene.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM | 3 Comments
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK) drops 2.7% after reporting Q2 revenue of $499.4M (-12% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK) drops 2.7% after reporting Q2 revenue of $499.4M (-12% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.62, missing consensus by $20M and $0.29. Gross margin fell to 2.2%, from 31.5% in Q1 and 18% in Q2 2010. The company expects 2011 revenue of $2.5B-$2.7B, above a $2.4B consensus, with a gross margin of 15-20%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM
  • BMY

    Bank of America raises its price target on shares of Bristol-Myers Squibb (NYSE:BMY) to $32 on...

    Bank of America raises its price target on shares of Bristol-Myers Squibb (NYSE:BMY) to $32 on the strength of the success of clinical trials of the drugmaker's blood thinner medication it plans to take to market with Pfizer (NYSE:PFE). Regulatory filing is expected in Q3 or Q4, with potential approval in mid-2012. Premarket: BMY +1.9%, PFE +2.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:28 AM
